name: Dedicated Quotation
Sales Order Opportunity
Sales Invoice Opportunity
Sales Order
script:
# Server Script (Type: API)
# API Method: create_contract_for_so
# NOTE: In Server Scripts, do not import modules and do not define functions.
# Use top-level code, frappe.form_dict, frappe.get_doc, frappe.db.get_value, etc.

# ---- Read args from client ----
sales_order = frappe.form_dict.get('sales_order')
template_name = "RMT Contract"
if not sales_order:
    frappe.throw("Missing 'sales_order' argument.")

# ---- Load Sales Order ----
so = frappe.get_doc("Sales Order", sales_order)


# ---- Prepare context for template rendering ----
# Use fieldnames your template expects (ERPNext examples commonly use party_name/start_date/etc.)
customer = so.get("customer") or ""
customer_name = frappe.db.get_value("Customer", customer, "customer_name") or customer

payload_doc = {
    "party_type": "Customer",
    # In Contract, 'party_name' is a Dynamic Link; most templates display the readable name:
    "party_name": customer_name,
    "start_date": frappe.utils.nowdate(),
    # Provide optional values if your template uses them:
    "end_date": None,
    "document_type": "Sales Order",
    "document_name": so.name,
    # Add any extra variables your template needs (e.g., totals, items, company, etc.)
}

# ---- Render terms from Contract Template ----
rendered_terms = None
try:
    # Use ERPNext's official template renderer for Contract Templates.
    # It returns {"contract_template": <Doc>, "contract_terms": "<HTML/Text>"}
    result = frappe.call(
        method="erpnext.crm.doctype.contract_template.contract_template.get_contract_template",
        template_name=template_name,
        doc=payload_doc,
    )
    rendered_terms = (result or {}).get("contract_terms")
except Exception:
    rendered_terms = None

# Fallback: render locally if needed
if not rendered_terms:
    try:
        tmpl = frappe.get_doc("Contract Template", template_name)
        if tmpl.get("contract_terms"):
            rendered_terms = frappe.render_template(tmpl.get("contract_terms"), payload_doc)
    except Exception:
        rendered_terms = None

if not rendered_terms:
    frappe.throw("Could not render Contract Terms from template: " + template_name)

# ---- Create Contract ----
contract = frappe.new_doc("Contract")

# Party / linkage fields
try:
    contract.party_type = "Customer"
except Exception:
    pass
try:
    # For Dynamic Link 'party_name', you can store the *Customer ID* (customer) or display name.
    # If your site expects the ID, use 'customer'; if display name, use 'customer_name'.
    contract.party_name = customer  # change to 'customer_name' if your schema expects that
except Exception:
    pass

contract.start_date = payload_doc["start_date"]
contract.status = "Unsigned"  # default lifecycle
contract.contract_template = template_name
contract.contract_terms = rendered_terms

# Optionally link back to the source SO for traceability
try:
    contract.document_type = "Sales Order"
    contract.document_name = so.name
except Exception:
    pass

contract.insert(ignore_permissions=True)

# ---- Link Contract back onto the Sales Order ----
link_field = "contract"  # change if your Sales Order's link field uses a different fieldname
if link_field in so.as_dict():
    so.set(link_field, contract.name)
    so.save(ignore_permissions=True)

# ---- Respond with the Contract name so the client can open it ----
frappe.response["message"] = contract.name

name: Block Sales Order Submission
Intercompany Transfer
